title: ‘Suits’ Fully Made a Joke About Prince Harry in the Season Finale
text:
From Marie Claire

The season finale of Suits made a joke about Prince Harry.

The show also paid homage to Meghan Markle (who they also joked about a few episodes back).

Before she was a casual duchess wandering around the world doing casual duchess-y things, Meghan Markle had a starring role on the Emmy-deserving-but-never-winning-wow-the-AUDACITY series Suits. Naturally, Meghan ditched the show upon marrying into the royal family, and now Suits appears to be spending its time packing as many royal LOLs into the final season as it possibly can.

Which brings us to the show fully making a joke about Prince Harry in the September 25 season finale ahead of Louis’s wedding to Sheila. Basically, Louis looks all kinds of fancy, and Harvey is just all, “Wait a second. Are you wearing a morning coat?” to which Louis replies, “Of course I’m wearing a morning coat. Frankly, I’m disappointed you’re not.” AND THEN, Harvey is just all, “Louis, you’re not the prince of England.”

Ha ha ha, get it?

The episode also payed homage to Meghan by way of a sweet montage, and lest you forget, they also made a joke about her becoming a duchess a few episodes back. The moment went down when Mike Ross showed up for a visit and gave everyone an update on how Meghan’s character, Rachel, is doing, saying, “If I told you how good, you probably wouldn’t believe me.”

GET IT, ’CAUSE SHE’S A DUCHESS.
